name: Stacks Info
description:
### Stacks Info

With this extension you can view all the info about your stacks.

You can then use a function after this block to manipulate and filter all the data you need to use it.

name: Stacks Name
description:
### Stacks Name

With this extension you can view all the stacks available on your host.

name: Stack Inspect
description:
### Stack Inspect

With this extension you can view, giving the name of a stack, all the containers and their configurations related to it.

You can use "Stack Info" extension to take stack's name.

name: Export Docker-Compose
description:
### Export Docker-Compose

With this extension you can export the docker-compose.yml of your stack.

You need to configure this block with the id of your stack (you can use "Stack Info" extension to take it).

name: Import Docker-Compose
description:
### Import Docker-Compose

With this extension you can run a docker-compose.yml on your host.

Give a name to the new stack and select .yml file to import.

args.name: name_new_stack
args.label: Stack name
args.helper: Give a name to your new stack

name: Registries List
description:
### Registries List

With this extension you can view all the registries you are logged in on your host.

name: Volumes List
description:
### Volumes List

With this extension you can view all the volumes created on your host.

name: List images in Livetech Registry
description:
### List images in Livetech Docker Registry
With this extension you can see all Docker images pushed on Private Livetech Registry.

You need to configure this block with the name of the image you want to search.

You don't need to insert the full name of the image, but you can use also search a part of it.

*(for example, you can insert "stor" to searching "storage")*

name: List libraries in Livetech Pypiserver
description:
### List python libraries in Livetech Pypiserver
With this extension you can see all Python libraries pushed on Private Livetech Pypiserver.

You need to configure this block with the name of the python library you want to search.

You don't need to insert the full name of the image, but you can use also search a part of it.

*(for example, you can insert "stor" to searching "storage")*

args.name: python_lib
args.label: Python Library Name
args.helper: Image name to search. IMPORTANT: insert the EXACT name of the library
